1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 16) (Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment – Ancillary Provisions) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020.

“Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment. 

191A.(1) In the case of a decision made in accordance with

(2) In the case of a decision by a deciding officer in

lower than the maximum band, the Minister shall, as soon as may 
be after the decision is made, cause a memorandum of –

the reasons for the said decision, 

to issue to the claimant.”, 

and 

(d) by the insertion of the following article after 223E: 

“Payment of Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment 
with other social welfare payments. 

223F. (1) Notwithstanding section 247(1) or (2), where, a person 
is entitled to, a payment under Chapter 12B of the Act and any 
payment specified in sub-article (2) would be payable to or in respect 
of a person, both such payments may be paid to or in respect of that 
person in respect of that period, if the person meets the eligibility 
conditions of both payments. 

(2) The following payments are specified for the purposes of

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for ancillary matters arising from the insertion by 
the Social Welfare (Covid-19) (Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 12 of 2020) of 
provisions dealing with the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment into 
the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005. 

The Regulations provide that as respects the prescribed time for making a 
claim for Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment and the circumstances 
under which late claims may be accepted, the same provisions will apply as 
apply to jobseeker’s benefit. 

The Regulations also provide that where a decision made by a Deciding Officer 
relates to 

• 

• 

the non-approval of a claim for the Covid-19 pandemic 
unemployment payment, or 

the rate at which the Covid-19 pandemic unemployment 
payment is paid is less than the maximum rate, 

the claimant must be advised of the decision in writing and the reasons for that 
decision. 

Finally, the Regulations specify the social welfare payments which may be 
paid concurrently with Covid-19 pandemic unemployment payment.
